body:
i’m thankful to have been walking through a bus station near gangnam to meet JK for lunch and, rounding a corner, to have seen a group of people stopped in place in the middle of the walkway, staring openmouthed up at a television where two old men in suits were shaking hands![](https://buttondown-attachments.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/309cf046-8543-4156-853f-9ebe173f14ae.jpeg?AWSAccessKeyId=AKIAJEXF6S6TCOKT7N3Q&Signature=voJlOwmlVL8GQFb0GvcXOVREbco%3D&Expires=1707571769)
i’m thankful for the hope of the moment, and for the feeling that i was standing in the middle of history as it happened, which was powerful, but i’m also thankful, as i witness the easy social media triumphalism about it from various commentators, for this story that JK wrote when we were in grad school, a dark fable about reunion, which explores her feelings about how inadequate hope might be to scarring the gash in between the two koreas:

[https://iowareview.org/from-the-issue/volume-45-issue-2-—-fall-2015/reunion](https://iowareview.org/from-the-issue/volume-45-issue-2-%E2%80%94-fall-2015/reunion)

i’m thankful for hope and i’m thankful also for doubt.
